titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-394, by Mr. Linder.

The requirement of clause 4(b) of rule XI for a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House is waived with respect to any resolution reported from that committee before November 11, 1997, providing for consideration or disposition of any of the following: 1) a bill or joint resolution making general appropriations for FY 1998, any amendment thereto, any conference report thereon, or any amendment reported in disagreement from a conference

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 133.

action.text: Mr. Solomon asked unanimous consent that the resolution be considered as having been amended when called up.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

At the Conclusion of debate, the Speaker put the question on agreeing to the resolution and announced that, by voice vote the resolution was agreed to. Ms. Slaughter demanded the Yeas and Nays and further proceedings were postponed.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 213 - 193 (Roll no. 630).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/12/1997--Passed House amended. Waives provisions of rule XI of the Rules of the House of Representatives that require a two-thirds vote to consider a report from the Committee on Rules on the same day it is presented to the House with respect to resolutions reported from such Committee before November 15, 1997, to provide for the consideration or disposition of: (1) a bill or joint resolution (including any amendment, conference report, or any amendment from conference in disagreement thereon) that makes general appropriations for FY 1998 or includes provisions making continuing appropriations for FY 1998; (2) H.R. 2621 (reciprocal trade agreement authorities); and (3) S. 1454 (extension of highway, highway safety, and transit programs). Makes it in order at any time before November 15, 1997, for the Speaker to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules, provided that the object of any such motion is announced from the House floor at least one hour before the motion is offered.
